job_title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) in Raleigh, NC
pros: Staff I worked with was amazing for taking care of the chronically ill!
cons: Passive aggressive two faced leadership. They make up their own policies and treat you like a criminal if you do not do something to their liking. Which explains the 3 star overall review for this company. Bully employees to make them think they are crazy as well as gaslight them. They expect you to know everything yet they lack the basic leadership knowledge to give you resources. Have a hard time retaining anyone due to treating the good employees horribly and then cry wolf when they can’t find anyone else.

pros: Felt supported by management, friendly co-workers, make your own schedule, PTO, yearly raises

They almost are like family, we can all joke and relax with each other. The pay is pretty decent compared to the east of north Carolina and the west of North Carolina. The education is good within the OR, if you want to learn to scrub they try to make the time.
cons: Maternity leave isn’t great, HR is not helpful at all.

job_title: Document Imaging Technician in Raleigh, NC
pros: The pros are minimal but the nursing staff is nice and professional.
cons: The facilities are forty years old and out of date to the point of being cost effective to replace than to update. Leadership is based out of Chapel Hill so there is no real connection between individual facility leadership is disconnected in relationship to their employees. The current leadership throughout is currently more concerned about politics(keeping masking and other universal protections in place, etc.) even though standards set by state leadership(which runs the entire system) have changed to lesser restrictions or that the job may not require said protections. Benefits are very expensive and based on Full/Part-time employment outside of the plan. There is a high turnover rate caused by: an aging staff, how COVID is being handled, and a disconnect between the state, system head, and the individual leaderships.

review_title: Nursing Assistant: Great company to work for.
pros: I have been working for Rex Healthcare for six years now. The benefits are great. The overall atmosphere at Rex is laid back and friendly. I actually enjoy coming to work most days. Overall, this is a great place to work.
cons: The biggest challenge thus far is working with so many different people. At times it can be overwhelming to try to fit in with such a diverse crowd. My manager at times seems as if she does not know what is going on within the organization. I feel as if the units are so unorganized. We all need to be on the same page and know exactly what to expect in every situation. When I have a question about getting a task complete, I should not have to ask five different people in order to get an answer. There should be someone or a notebook that explains what should be done or how to handle the situation.

job_title: Licensed Physical Therapist Assistant (LPTA) in Raleigh, NC
pros: Stability, strong teams, ethical, many awards, great benefits
cons: Don’t promote within, low salaries, limited career growth unless you’re an RN

job_title: Clinical Nurse Educator in Raleigh, NC
pros: Hospital culture friendly, yearly raise usually, leadership approachable, Leadership does care
cons: Needs improvement holding staff accountable, Leadership roles are often preselected, Short staffed, Unmanageable workloads at times

pros: There is a sense of community at Tex hospital whether by staff or the public
cons: Focus more on long term outcomes.

pros: Culture, family feel, excellent quality care, leaders care about their teams
cons: Healthcare is a challenging field during a pandemic

pros: Friendly staff, generous PTO, generally positive work environment.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Raleigh, NC
pros: guaranteed healthcare job during pandemic
cons: unfriendly, unhelpful and unkind coworkers, backbiting staff

review_title: Well run hospital in a tough field
pros: The culture at Rex is great. They seem to care about the employees. Good benefits.  Anyone who knows about the business of healthcare knows how hard it can be to stay afloat.  I think Rex does a good job of making sure that they operate in a way that keeps the doors open without making dramatic shifts (such as letting people go, changing services, cutting funding, etc.).  Upper management does a good job of trying to be transparent in an ever-shifting industry.
cons: The HR department isn't big enough.  I feel there are too many employees for such a small HR group.  Feels easy enough to make lateral moves, but hard to move "up the ladder", which can make you feel trapped. Pay isn't that great in some positions, but that is expected in a hospital I feel.

job_title: Document Imaging Technician in Raleigh, NC
pros: Co-worker team building is reasonable.
cons: There is no incentive plan.  All decisions are made in a disconnected corporation style, due to being made by leadership that is not on individual sites.  Cost of living is not included in pay rates.   Disability hiring is somewhat frowned upon.  Special interest groups, and religious discrimination are priorities over co-worker needs.  Managerial harassment of under performing employees is disguised as assistance.  There is a high turnover rate currently.  Appreciation especially in the area of longevity is only shown currently when employees leave.

review_title: I enjoyed my time at Rex Healthcare
pros: I was with Rex Healthcare for just under 14 years.  During my time there I got to see how Rex not only dealt with their patients, but with their employees...  compassion.  Rex for the most part feels like a 'family'.  There are many employees that have been with Rex for well over 20 years.  One of my users just celebrated her 45 year anniversary.
cons: While Rex can seem like a 'family' type of environment, it is slowly growing toward the 'corporate' feel.  While I do feel a business has to make decisions *for* the business... it should not disregard what these decisions will do to their employees.  Making enterprise-wide decisions without thinking of the effect on employees reduces employee morale and increases turnover.

pros: Great staff and physicians!  Warm, hospitable employees who truly care about the patients, the physicians, and the community.  People take pride in their jobs and it reflects in the excellent care that is given.
cons: There is entirely too much middle management at Rex.  Departments are, unfortunately, managed by individuals who do not actually do the work, do not understand the work flow, and/or are not truly qualified to evaluate job performance because they are not registered/certified in a particular modality.  There is a basic lack of communication from senior management down.

pros: The vast majority of my Rex co-workers are truly wonderful, dedicated professionals. Based on conversations I've had with employees of other area hospitals, it seems Rex is highly-regarded industry-wide.  I'm proud to work here.
cons:
Rex (as part of the UHC system) is implementing Epic this year.  The planning and training requirements are leaving departments short-staffed and stressed.  Not great timing for a hiring freeze this past year. 
Also, we're noticing a change in the mood and overall culture since we've started aligning more with UNC standards.  Becoming more "corporate", stratified.  Morale is starting to suffer, at least from what I've noticed.

review_title: Ok job, coworkers are nice and work as a team, job is very stressful and I never leave on time, raises are tiny
pros: Everyone is really nice, most people work together well and work hard, scheduling/staffing is organized, usually a srt/float nurse is available when needed
cons: High stress/long hours, pay much lower than I made in other part of country even though cost of living is same

pros: prior to the UNC takeover it was one of the best places I've ever worked
cons: since the takeover, UNC goals (primarily financial) have taken over and pushed out almost all of the senior Rex management.  I left when it became apparent that money was the ONLY thing that matters to UNC.  Also, benefits that were once great went under the UNC benefit system and my deductible went from 0 to $1,500 a year.  The benefits plan also encouraged my moving to UNC physicians and my doctors were not part of their serviced.

review_title: I would not recommend working here.
pros: Some of my peers and doctors are ok.
cons: They treat new employees like garbage. You get the worst shift, little to no breaks, and the pay sucks.

pros: Great teamwork in my department! My coworkers are fabulous and always willing to help so that our patients feel they are #1
cons: Recently we have had a lot of turn over to other locations. Same clinic just different location with a different manager. My coworker are leaving because of poor management. And many are looking for other jobs- some outside of UNC Rex

review_title: Rex Healthcare is a great place to work
pros: Very caring and friendly management and staff. The environment at Rex is one that is supportive and strives to be healthy.
cons: Huge transitional period with Epic and UNC merge. There is a lot of confusion in healthcare now and Rex is struggling with aligning itself with UNC and the chaos of the intorduction of Epic and new healthcare laws.

review_title: Great company to work for!! I left and came right back.
job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Raleigh, NC
pros: They currently offer a decent benefits package with options for medical, dental, vision, long and short term disability as well as life insurance.  The company values are very good.
cons: There is a small amount of micromanaging that can be frustrating, training is mostly computer modules, and the sick time-off policies are harsh.

review_title: Better than not having a job at all
pros: Hard to come up with too many pros. Lower level staff try really hard to maintain  high level quality care.
cons: Here at Rex we've moved our focus away from quality care and focus solely on budget. While i understand why management has done it, its still sad that people aren't recieveing the care that they deserve.

pros: Rex is one of the best companies i've ever worked for. The family type atmosphere and people give the hospital a good feeling that you are part of something great.
cons: Currently Merging with UNC Healthcare in multiple areas and starting to get the typical state government feel that mediocre is good enough.

pros: It is a magnet hospital and the nurses like working there.  The hospital is nurse focused.  There is a good relationship between hospitalist and RN.
cons: Does not pay as well as surrounding hospital.  In order to compensate for the lost of monies from medicare, staffing is strictly being monitored which can leave the hospital floor short staffed.

job_title: Human Resources Consultant in Morrisville, NC
pros: I have been at UNC REX for just under 11 years and it is an awesome place to work.  I have worked on the REX campus and now I'm in the shared Service Center in Morrisville. There are great opportunities to learn and grow in this organization.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: Teamwork is good, morale is high, good benefits, good shift differentials, nurses mostly treated with respect by doctors...there are always exceptions of course.
cons: Low base salary, cafeteria does not have the best options for healthy eating, the building is old, the wows are not always functional

job_title: Document Imaging Technician in Raleigh, NC
pros: Pros include: multiple facility sites, easy access to medical care, childcare facility on site, physician practices on site, volunteer opportunities, community relations.
cons: Cons include: fewer chances of promotion for non-specialized employees, low compensation rates in comparison to living costs, and extremely large employee base.

pros: Pay and medical benefits good. Not worth all the drama though.
cons: Poor upper management. Work environment revolves around cliques, favoritism and gossip. I loved the job, I hated the environment I worked in. Some fantastic people. Also, some very underhanded, gossipy and shallow people, at least in the ER where I worked.

pros: One of the best companies in Raleigh to work for.  Excellent benefits, and they genuinely care about your concerns and take your ideas into consideration.  Staff is amazing, always smiling and willing to help each other.
cons: The hiring process is long and it's difficult for people to get in with the company.

pros:
Great work culture. Coworkers are wonderful, helpful, and sincere.

Senior Management work diligently at making sure all coworkers stay informed and feel a part of the company.
Company has really good benefits.
cons: Career progression can be limited dependent upon your leadership
